member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Constructor for EventProvider class.
member.param: Unique GUID among all trace sources running on a system

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.EtwRegister
member.summary: This method registers the controlGuid of this class with ETW. We need to be running on Vista or above. If not an PlatformNotSupported exception will be thrown. If for some reason the ETW EtwRegister call failed a NotSupported exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.Close
member.summary: This method deregisters the controlGuid of this class with ETW.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.Deregister
member.summary: This method un-registers from ETW.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.IsEnabled
member.summary: IsEnabled, method used to test if provider is enabled

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.IsEnabled(System.Byte,System.Int64)
member.summary: IsEnabled, method used to test if event is enabled

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteMessageEvent(System.String,System.Byte,System.Int64)
member.summary: WriteMessageEvent, method to write a string with level and Keyword. The activity ID will be propagated only if the call stays on the same native thread as SetActivityId().

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteMessageEvent(System.String)
member.summary: WriteMessageEvent, method to write a string with level=0 and Keyword=0 The activity ID will be propagated only if the call stays on the same native thread as SetActivityId().

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent(System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor@,System.Object[])
member.summary: WriteEvent method to write parameters with event schema properties

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent(System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor@,System.String)
member.summary: WriteEvent, method to write a string with event schema properties

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent(System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor@,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: WriteEvent, method to be used by generated code on a derived class

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteTransferEvent(System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor@,System.Guid,System.Object[])
member.summary: WriteTransferEvent, method to write a parameters with event schema properties

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProviderTraceListener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This method creates an instance of the ETW provider. The guid argument must be a valid GUID or a format exception will be thrown when creating an instance of the ControlGuid. We need to be running on Vista or above. If not an PlatformNotSupported exception will be thrown by the EventProvider.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventBookmark
member.summary: Represents an opaque Event Bookmark obtained from an EventRecord. The bookmark denotes a unique identifier for the event instance as well as marks the location in the the result set of the EventReader that the event instance was obtained from.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventKeyword
member.summary: Describes the metadata for a specific Keyword defined by a Provider. An instance of this class is obtained from a ProviderMetadata object.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLevel
member.summary: Describes the metadata for a specific Level defined by a Provider. An instance of this class is obtained from a ProviderMetadata object.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogType
member.summary: Log Type

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogIsolation
member.summary: Log Isolation

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogMode
member.summary: Log Mode

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogConfiguration
member.summary: Provides access to static log information and configures log publishing and log file properties.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogNotFoundException
member.summary: The object requested by the operation is not found.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReadingException
member.summary: The state of the reader cursor has become invalid, most likely due to the fact that the log has been cleared. User needs to obtain a new reader object if they wish to continue navigating result set.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogProviderDisabledException
member.summary: Provider has been uninstalled while ProviderMetadata operations are being performed. Obtain a new ProviderMetadata object, when provider is reinstalled, to continue navigating provider's metadata.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogInvalidDataException
member.summary: Data obtained from the eventlog service, for the current operation, is invalid .

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogInformation
member.summary: Describes the run-time properties of logs and external log files. An instance of this class is obtained from EventLogSession.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogLink
member.summary: Describes the metadata for a specific Log Reference defined by a Provider. An instance of this class is obtained from a ProviderMetadata object.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogPropertySelector
member.summary: Encapsulates the information for fast access to Event Values of an EventLogRecord. An instance of this class is constructed and then passed to EventLogRecord.GetEventPropertyValues.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogQuery
member.summary: Allows a user to define events of interest. An instance of this class is passed to an EventReader to actually obtain the EventRecords. The EventLogQuery can be as simple specifying that all events are of interest, or it can contain query / xpath expressions that indicate exactly what characteristics events should have.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader
member.summary: This public class is used for reading event records from event log.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader._eventsBuffer
member.summary: events buffer holds batched event (handles).

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader._currentIndex
member.summary: The current index where the function GetNextEvent is (inside the eventsBuffer).

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader._eventCount
member.summary: The number of events read from the batch into the eventsBuffer

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader._isEof
member.summary: When the reader finishes (will always return only ERROR_NO_MORE_ITEMS). For subscription, this means we need to wait for next event.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogReader._cachedMetadataInformation
member.summary: Maintains cached display / metadata information returned from EventRecords that were obtained from this reader.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.SessionAuthentication
member.summary: Session Login Type

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType
member.summary: The type: log / external log file to query

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogStatus
member.summary: Describes the status of a particular log with respect to an instantiated EventLogReader. Since it is possible to instantiate an EventLogReader with a query containing multiple logs and the reader can be configured to tolerate errors in attaching to those logs, this class allows the user to determine exactly what the status of those logs is.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventMetadata
member.summary: Event Metadata

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord
member.summary: Represents an event obtained from an EventReader.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventTask
member.summary: Describes the metadata for a specific Task defined by a Provider. An instance of this class is obtained from a ProviderMetadata object.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.ProviderMetadata
member.summary: Exposes all the metadata for a specific event Provider. An instance of this class is obtained from EventLogManagement and is scoped to a single Locale.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current threads CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:DotNetEventingStrings.ArgumentOutOfRange_NeedNonNegNum
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Non negative number is required.

member.name: P:DotNetEventingStrings.ArgumentOutOfRange_NeedValidId
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ID parameter must be in the range {0} through {1}.

member.name: P:DotNetEventingStrings.ArgumentOutOfRange_MaxArgExceeded
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The total number of parameters must not exceed {0}.

member.name: P:DotNetEventingStrings.ArgumentOutOfRange_MaxStringsExceeded
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of String parameters must not exceed {0}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Delimiter cannot be an empty string.
